item.title: Full up dog waste bin, 23rd August
item.description:
Dog waste bin is full up, with a lot of bags around it. The bags are now scattered around the green, and have been brought through to my garden by foxes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Kilda Road, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Neighbour’s overhanging laurels blocking light, 23rd August
item.description:
Large laurel trees in Wirral Wood Close are overhanging the Shade Garden and making growing conditions even more difficult. We have been advised by our London in Bloom judge to ask for them to be reduced to fence line so we can develop the garden. Branches are too high and large for FOCRG Gardening Club to tackle. Please may we have some professional help? Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wirral Wood Close, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish, 23rd August
item.description:
A mattress and rubbish have been left in the car park by the back on the shops in Stapley Road. There is food dirty nappies and it is full of flies. It’s been reported before and nothing done. Stapley Road never gets rubbish cleared or even swept it’s a disgrace
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Stapley Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Every drain within 100m radius is blocked, 23rd August
item.description:
Every drain on colyers lane, Normandy way and surrounding areas are blocked and causing a smell. You clearly know they are blocked as you’ve sprayed them with blue spray paint saying blocked. My previous problem you said was a Thames water problem, they came and did what they could but said it’s the councils problem. Please send people to clear all the gulleys.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colyers Lane, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
